body_html:
@soumith What do you recommend? Just using a non-apple clang? I think you closed this issue a bit too early, as Apple clang clearly does not support OpenMP (see also this reddit thread):

$ clang --version # Newest command line tools for 10.13.4 install
Apple LLVM version 9.1.0 (clang-902.0.39.1)
$ clang -fopenmp test.c -o test
clang: error: unsupported option '-fopenmp'
body_text:
@soumith  What do you recommend? Just using a non-apple clang? I think you closed this issue a bit too early, as Apple clang clearly does not support OpenMP (see also this reddit thread):
$ clang --version # Newest command line tools for 10.13.4 install
Apple LLVM version 9.1.0 (clang-902.0.39.1)
$ clang -fopenmp test.c -o test
clang: error: unsupported option '-fopenmp'
body:
@soumith  What do you recommend? Just using a non-apple clang? I think you closed this issue a bit too early, as Apple clang clearly does not support OpenMP (see also this [reddit thread](https://www.reddit.com/r/MacOS/comments/71hz1n/does_apple_bundled_clang_have_openmp_support_in/)):
```shell
$ clang --version # Newest command line tools for 10.13.4 install
Apple LLVM version 9.1.0 (clang-902.0.39.1)
$ clang -fopenmp test.c -o test
clang: error: unsupported option '-fopenmp'
```
